metadata.name: Suspicious AgentExecutor PowerShell Execution
metadata.comment: Detects execution of the AgentExecutor.exe binary. Which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute powershell scripts with the ExecutionPolicy "Bypass" or any binary named "powershell.exe" located in the path provided by 6th positional argument

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\agentexecutor.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('agentexecutor.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -powershell')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -remediationscript'))) AND NOT (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('c:\\windows\\system32\\windowspowershell\\v1.0\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('c:\\windows\\syswow64\\windowspowershell\\v1.0\\')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\microsoft.management.services.intunewindowsagent.exe'))))

output.summary: Detects execution of the AgentExecutor.exe binary. Which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute powershell scripts with the ExecutionPolicy "Bypass" or any binary named "powershell.exe" located in the path provided by 6th positional argument
